Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: CORE ID: Unique identifier for a well core
Column Comment.3: SHIFT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Observation number defining the uniqueness foreach core shift depth.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the core intervalbeing adjusted.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base depth interval original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: BASE SHIFT DEPTH: Adjusted depth of the base of the core interval.
Column Comment.8: BASE SHIFT DEPTH OUOM: Base shift interval original unit of measure.
Column Comment.9: CORE SHIFT COMPANY: The company that performed the core shift.
Column Comment.10: CORE SHIFT INDICATOR: Indicates if the core interval being adjusted representsthe entire cored segment. This is a Yes/No flag.
Column Comment.11: CORE SHIFT METHOD: This reference table defines the method used to correctcore depths to adjusted wireline log depths.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the core interval beingadjusted.
Column Comment.17: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top depth interval original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: TOP SHIFT DEPTH: Adjusted depth of the top of the core interval.
Column Comment.19: TOP SHIFT DEPTH OUOM: Top shift interval original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
